py_sim.path_planning.rrt_procedures module¶

rrt_procedures defines the low level, general procedures for the rrt algorithm

py_sim.path_planning.rrt_procedures.Cost¶

Storage structure for storing the cost of a node in the graph it maps from node index to cost

Type:

dict[int, float]

py_sim.path_planning.rrt_procedures.biased_sample(iteration: int, bias_t: int, X: StateSpace, X_t: StateSpace) → TwoDimArray¶

Returns a biased sampling of the state space. X is sampled uniformly except when mod(iteration, bias_t) == 0

Parameters:

  • iteration – the iteration number for the sampling

  • bias_t – The sampling bias period

  • X – The large state space

  • X_t – The smaller, target state space

Returns:

A random sample of the state space biased towards the target set

Return type:

TwoDimArray

py_sim.path_planning.rrt_procedures.children(ind_p: int, tree: DirectedPathGraph) → list[int]¶

Returns every node that has ind_p as the parent index

Parameters:

  • ind_p – index of the node being evaluated

  • tree – search tree

Returns:

List of all of the indices to the children node of the node correponding to ind_p

Return type:

list[int]

py_sim.path_planning.rrt_procedures.collision_free(path: ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]], world: World) → bool¶

Returns true if and only if path is obstacle free

Parameters:

  • path – 2xn matrix where each column is a position

  • world – world used to check each individual edge for obstacles

Returns:

Whether (True) or not (False) the path is obstacle free

Return type:

bool

py_sim.path_planning.rrt_procedures.cost_to_come(x_n: TwoDimArray, ind_p: int, tree: DirectedPathGraph, cost: dict[int, float], world: World) → float¶

Calculates the cost of x_n if it were connected to the tree to the parent indexed with ind_p. It returns infinite cost if the path is blocked

Parameters:

  • x_n – Potential new node to be added

  • ind_p – The parent index to which a connection with x_n is being evaluated

  • tree – search tree

  • cost – dictionary of costs

  • world – World through which the edge is being added

Returns:

cost of connecting to x_n from the indicated parent index

Return type:

float

py_sim.path_planning.rrt_procedures.edge_cost(node_1: TwoDimArray, node_2: TwoDimArray) → float¶

Calculates the cost of an edge. Uses euclidean distance

Parameters:

  • point (node_2- The second) –

  • point –

Returns:

The cost of the edge

Return type:

float

py_sim.path_planning.rrt_procedures.get_path(x_start: TwoDimArray, x_end: TwoDimArray) → ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]]¶

Builds an ordered set of states that connect the state x_start to x_end without considering obstacles

The current implementation only puts x_start and x_end together. Future modifications could create a series of points bewteen them

Parameters:

  • x_start – starting point

  • x_end – ending point

Returns:

2xn matrix where each column is a state. The first column is x_start and second is x_end

Return type:

npt.NDArray[Any]

py_sim.path_planning.rrt_procedures.initialize(root: TwoDimArray) → tuple[py_sim.path_planning.graph_search.DirectedPathGraph, dict[int, float]]¶

Returns an initialized tree with the given root and no edges

Parameters:

root – Root node to be added to the tree

Returns:

Initialized tree and the resulting dictionary of costs to be updated

Return type:

tuple[Tree, Cost]

py_sim.path_planning.rrt_procedures.insert_node(new_node: TwoDimArray, parent_ind: int, tree: DirectedPathGraph, cost: dict[int, float]) → int¶
Adds the node, new_node, into the tree with parent_ind indicating the parent index. The cost

to the new node is then updated using edge_cost

Parameters:

  • new_node – Node position to be added to the tree

  • parent_ind – Index of the parent to which the node will be added

  • tree – search tree

  • cost – dictionary node indices to costs

Returns:

Index of the new node within the tree

Return type:

int

py_sim.path_planning.rrt_procedures.near(x: TwoDimArray, tree: DirectedPathGraph, n_nearest: int) → tuple[list[numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[Any]]], list[int]]¶

Finds the nearest n_nearest vertices that are in the tree

Parameters:

  • x – State about which the search is performed

  • tree – Tree over which the search is performed

  • n_nearest – Number of nearest items to search

Returns:

x_nearest: List of node states in the form of (2,) vector for each state

ind_nearest: List of node indices

Return type:

tuple[list[npt.NDArray[Any]], list[int]]

py_sim.path_planning.rrt_procedures.nearest(x: TwoDimArray, tree: DirectedPathGraph) → tuple[py_sim.tools.sim_types.TwoDimArray, int]¶

Returns the state in the tree nearest to x

Parameters:

  • x – State about which the search is performed

  • tree – Tree over which the search is performed

Returns:

x_nearest: State of the nearest node

ind_nearest: Node index of the nearest node

Return type:

tuple[TwoDimArray, int]

py_sim.path_planning.rrt_procedures.parent(ind_c: int, tree: DirectedPathGraph) → int | None¶

Returns the parent index of the node corresponding to ind_c or None if the node is the root

Parameters:

  • ind_c – The index of the node being evaluated

  • tree – search tree

Returns:

Index of the parent node, None if it does not exist

Return type:

Optional[int]

py_sim.path_planning.rrt_procedures.sample(X: StateSpace) → TwoDimArray¶

Returns a random state from the set with the specified limits

Parameters:

X – State space for sampling

Returns:

Position generated uniformly within the limits

Return type:

TwoDimArray

py_sim.path_planning.rrt_procedures.solution(node_index: int, tree: DirectedPathGraph) → tuple[list[float], list[float], list[int]]¶

Returns the solution that runs from the tree root to the node_index through the tree

Parameters:

  • node_index – Node in question

  • tree – search tree through which the path is determined

Returns:

x_vec: Vector of x indices

y_vec: Vector of y indices

ind_vec: Vector of node indices within the tree

Return type:

tuple[list[float], list[float], list[int]]

py_sim.path_planning.rrt_procedures.steer(x: TwoDimArray, y: TwoDimArray, dist: float) → TwoDimArray¶

Returns a point that is within a predefined distance, dist, from x in the direction of y

Parameters:

  • x – originating position

  • y – position defining the direction

  • dist – distance along the path for the point

Returns:

Calculated point in the direction of y

Return type:

TwoDimArray
